Detailed Description

Date:
2009-04-24
Author:
: Jean-Lou Dupont
The _queue_ module isn't aware of its elements and thus it is the responsibility of the clients to properly dispose of the _nodes_ once retrieved.

The term ``node`` is used generically to refer to a node element inside a queue.

Definition in file queue.c.

Creates a queue

Definition at line 30 of file queue.c.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void queue_destroy ( queue *  q  ) 

Destroys a queue

This function is **not** aware of the message(s) potentially inside the queue, thus, the queue must be drained **before** using this function.

The queue can be drained by:

  • stopping the thread that ``puts``
  • ``getting`` until NULL is returned

Puts a node at the HEAD of the queue

This function is meant to support _high priority_ messages.
